org.svvrl.goal.core

Interface Editable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAltAutomaton, AbstractEditable, AbstractNBWLikeAcc, AbstractNGBWLikeAcc, AbstractNRWLikeAcc, AbstractNTBWLikeAcc, AbstractNTGBWLikeAcc, AbstractNTRWLikeAcc, Acc, ACTLFormula, AltAutomaton, AltConnector, AltState, AltTransition, Automaton, AutomatonComponent, BuchiAcc, ClassicAcc, CoBuchiAcc, ConfigurationAutomaton, ConfigurationState, DelayedSimulation.LOSCompoundState, DelayedSimulation.LOTCompoundState, EditableCollection, EditableORE, EditableRE, FairSimulation.CompoundState, FormulaHolder, FSA, FSAState, FSATransition, Game, GameState, GameTransition, GeneralizedBuchiAcc, GraphicComponent, InputSimulator, Intersection.NBWIntersectState, Intersection.NFWIntersectState, MSState, MullerAcc, NBW2DCW.DCWState, NBW2NCW.NCWState, NGBW2NBWSet.OState, NMW2NBW.BuchiState, NPW2NBW.BuchiState, ParityAcc, PitermanState, PLFormula, ProfileAutomaton, QPTLFormula, RabinAcc, ReachabilityAcc, ReducedSplitTree, RunDag, RunTree, SafraState, ScheweState, SplitTree, State, StreettAcc, TBuchiAcc, TCoBuchiAcc, TGeneralizedBuchiAcc, TMullerAcc, TParityAcc, TRabinAcc, Transition, TStreettAcc, TwoWayAltAutomaton, TwoWayAltTransition

    public interface Editable
    This class defines objects that can be edited in GOAL. Three different types of properties can be associated with an editable object.
    1. Static properties: properties that will be stored with this object in a file such that when this object is restored from the file, the properties will not disappear.
    2. Runtime properties: properties that may disappear when this object is cleared from the memory. This type of properties is useful when an algorithm needs to put additional information on an object.
    3. Derived properties: properties that are computed from this object when the properties are retrieved.
    Some properties of an editable object may be built-in, that is, the properties exist when this object is designed. Such built-in properties should be stored in the properties object returned by getProperties().
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this object. If the name property is not set, an empty string will be returned.
        Returns:
        the name of this object

        Sets the description of this object.

      • getProperties

        Properties getProperties()
        Returns the properties of this object. The properties returned by this method should be saved when saving this object to a file.
        Returns:
        the properties of this object

      • getRuntimeProperties

        Properties getRuntimeProperties()
        Returns the runtime properties of this object. The runtime properties may disappear when this object is cleared from the memory.
        Returns:
        the runtime properties of this object

      • getDerivedProperties

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,DerivedProperty> getDerivedProperties()
        Returns the derived properties of this object. As a derived property is computed from this object when the property is retrieved, the changed of a derived property should never fire an EditableEvent.
        Returns:
        the derived properties of this object

      • getPropertyNames

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPropertyNames()
        Returns the names of non-runtime properties of this object.
        Returns:
        all property names

      • getBuiltinPropertyNames

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getBuiltinPropertyNames()
        Returns the built-in property names of this object. A built-in property is a property that already exists during the design of a subclass of Editable. Such properties should be stored in the object returned by getProperties().
        Returns:
        the built-in property names of this object

      • getProperty

        java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a property of this object. This method should find the property in the both properties returned by getProperties() and getRuntimeProperties().
        Parameters:
        name - the key of the property
        Returns:
        the value of the property, or null if this object does not have such property

      • addEditableListener

        void addEditableListener(EditableListener l)
        Adds a listener to receive the editable state events from this editable object.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to be added

      • removeEditableListener

        void removeEditableListener(EditableListener l)
        Removes the listener so that it no longer receives the editable state events from this editable object.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to be removed

      • copyInfo

        void copyInfo(Editable from,
              Editable to)
        Copies properties from an editable object to another editable object.
        Parameters:
        from - the source of the properties to be copied from
        to - the destination of the copied properties

      • getProperty

                             java.lang.String def)
        Deprecated. use getProperty(String), getProperties(), or getRuntimeProperties() instead
        Returns a property of this object.
        Parameters:
        name - the key of the property
        def - the default value of the property
        Returns:
        the value of the property, the default value def if the object does not have such property

      • getProperty

                int def)

        Parameters:

        def - the default value of the property

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Deprecated. use getProperties() or getRuntimeProperties() instead
        Sets a property of this editable object. This method should always fire an editable event if the new value is different from the old value.
        Parameters:
        name - the key of the property
        value - the value of the property, null to remove the property

      • setProperties

        void setProperties(Properties props)
        Deprecated. use getProperties() or getRuntimeProperties() instead
        Sets a set of properties of this editable object. After all properties are set, a single editable event should be fired.
        Parameters:
        props - a set of properties
